title: Mum called 'baby killer' after posting picture of stillborn triplets online | Metro News
text:
Toby Meyjes for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 5:14 pm Click to reveal Click to return (Picture: Caters) 
A mum who posted a picture of her stillborn children online has hit back at the trolls who called her a ‘baby killer’ and ‘psychopath’. 
Amanda Morrison put the images online to reach out to other mothers who lost a child during pregnancy. Teenager with skin as fragile as a butterfly wing is too frail to hug her family 
The 33-year-old had taken the pictures of her holding the children, and built a shrine at home, to mark the heartbreaking loss. 
But, as well as many positive responses, the 33-year-old, from Roswell in the USA, found herself the target of online abuse. 
‘I have had negative feedback, telling me it is disgusting to show my children’s pictures because they are dead,’ she said. Click to reveal Click to return (Picture: Caters) 
‘I have been called a baby killer and worse. I have been called a psychopath because I shared pictures of fetuses that never lived. I have been told horrible things. 
‘But I have found a lot of mums that have lost children that I have connected with, as we share a special bond.’ 
She added: ‘Like any child would, they leave pieces of themselves scattered around your home. 
‘My children were very real whether society wants to see it that way or not. 
‘They were loved and my love, a product of what love truly is. That’s my image of my babies.
